Is Cache expensive?

Compared to nearby areas, Cache is somewhat more expensive, and it is a lot less expensive compared to the nation as a whole. However it is a bit less expensive compared to the city of Oklahoma City.

Home prices

Cache's median home cost is $133,100. In comparison to nearby areas this is roughly $8,240 (6%) higher. In comparison to the rest of the nation it is approximately $84,400 (38%) lower, and compared to the city of Oklahoma City it is roughly $25,400 (16%) lower.

Rents

The median rent in Cache is $725 per month. This is about $133 (15%) lower compared to other places in this area. Compared to the rest of the nation it is roughly $337 (31%) lower, and compared to the city of Oklahoma City it is about $146 (16%) lower.

Nearby places

Medicine Park

Medicine Park is about 9 miles northeast from Cache. The housing prices there are significantly more expensive. Its median home cost is $226,200, which comes out to $93,100 (41%) higher than Cache.

Lawton

Lawton is about 9 miles east from Cache. Its housing prices are somewhat less expensive. The median home value there is $112,800, which is $20,300 (17%) lower than Cache.

Faxon

Faxon is approximately 12 miles south from Cache. The real estate prices there are fairly similar. The median home value there is $131,300, which is $1,800 (1%) lower than Cache.

Chattanooga

Chattanooga is about 15 miles south of Cache. Real estate prices there are a lot less expensive. The median home cost there is $78,100, which is $55,000 (70%) lower than Cache.

Geronimo

Geronimo is approximately 15 miles southeast of Cache. Housing prices there are a lot less expensive. Its median home price is $75,900, which works out to $57,200 (75%) lower than Cache.
